title: Likening Isaiah 3 unto Ourselves
html:
Things have hardly changed in twenty-five hundred years. As in Isaiah's time (see 3:1- 12), today wicked people from all walks of life speak evil things against the Lord and oppress their neighbors and others; even youngsters "behave…proudly" and speak out against the elderly (3:5). Many of the leaders are not without guilt, for they cause their people "to err" (3:12).

We, the Lord's people of today, are not always innocent of the transgressions listed in Isaiah's words concerning the "daughters of Zion" (3:13-4:1), for we also set our hearts on material goods: designer clothes, luxuries, and wealth.
